page.title: 01PREFACE
page.content: The whole extent of this block, composed of agricultural land lying at heights between l25-700 feet above sea level, may be seen from any of the knolls and crests into which it swells. Its character of small hedged pastures and hardwood copses of a few acres, and little arable, is dictated by the steepness of its slopes. The character of its communities too might be guessed at from the physical isolation from one another of its two small villages, Netherbury and Stoke Abbott seen lying a mile apart as the crow flies, but separated by 3 miles of road. The small town of Beaminister, bisected by the block perimiter, contains the P.O., shops and schools which the villages no longer possess; Beaminister is, too, the H.Q. of the Team Ministry which serves the scattered village churches.
